page.title: 19RAMSGATE HARBOUR
page.content: Ramsgate's harbour was built 200 years ago and is now changing dramatically. Once the home of a large fishing fleet, port of call for pleasure steamers from London and home of the first hovercraft service,it now is a yacht marina and a landing stage for imported foreign cars Adjoining the harbour,a large complex called Port Sally has been built to accommodate the Sally Line passenger and car ferries,and Schiaffino lorry ferries.Beyond the harbour,a long outer arm is being built to give a large area of still water;more jetties will be made;new roads will run along the shore to carry the large container lorries. Managing the harbour are Captains Phinn and Grieves who are in charge of all shipping traffic in and around the Sally complex and harbour.Trinity House pilot boats,Ramsgate's lifeboats and dredgers all work from the harbour.
